alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:37PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN SANDOVAL AND WEST CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM MDT... At 337 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kewa Pueblo, or 15 miles northeast of Bernalillo, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santo Domingo Pueblo, Cerrillos Hills State Park, San Felipe Pueblo, Kewa Pueblo, Cochiti Pueblo, Madrid, Los Cerrillos, Golden, Domingo and Algodones. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 247 and 266. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area
